intro: Polanisia trachysperma, commonly known as the rough-seeded polanisia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has hairy, rough-textured leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Polanisia trachysperma is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
